title: Healthcare Mask and Vaxx Mandate Quietly Ended
cleaned_text:
California’s healthcare mask and vaccine mandate has quietly come to an end. As of April 3, 2023, masks are no longer required in indoor high-risk and health care settings. Such settings include health care, long-term care, correctional facilities, homeless, emergency, warming and cooling centers. Local health departments and health care facilities may develop and implement plans according to their needs.

Also effective April 3, 2023, the State of California will no longer require vaccination for health care workers. This includes various settings such as adult care, direct care, correctional facilities, and detention centers. Local health departments and health care facilities may develop and implement plans according to their needs.

Read more directly from the California Department of Public Health.
